p: B cells are critical in adaptive immunity via production of antibodies and cytokines. In patients with demyelinating polyneuropathy, administration of IVIg was associated with overexpression of FcγRIIB receptors on B cells [ 101, 102]. IVIg abrogated TLR-9-dependent B cell responses. This was associated with IVIg inhibitions of NF-κB signaling pathway, reduction of CD25 and CD40 expression, and reduction of IL-6 and IL-10 production by B cells. This process seems to be regulated by SH2 domain–containing phosphatase 1 [ 103].
